discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A Warm Site would have hardware already in place, just need to bring software. Less expensive than a Hot Site

Selected Answer: C
A cold site is a backup facility with basic infrastructure but no IT equipment, which takes time to get up and running in the event of a disaster. A hot site is a backup facility with all necessary IT systems and equipment ready for immediate use but is more expensive to maintain. A warm site is between a cold and hot site, having some pre-installed IT systems and equipment, but still requiring effort to get up and running in the event of a disaster.
Cloud is more cost effective than warm and hot. No?

Selected Answer: C
Warm Site = Restoral time between 24 hours & seven days (under a week). = An available building that already contains a lot of the equipment. With this equipment, you may not have the latest security patches, or even the data backups from your other site have not been recovered yet, but at least have the hardware & cabling. This holds your switches, routers, & firewalls .

Selected Answer: C
C - warm site correct
The correct answer is Hot Site

comments.content: Incorrect - Hot site would mean they have a 1 to 1 with equipment, networking, application/software.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A warm site is a leased facility that contains electrical and communications wiring, full
utilities, and networking equipment. In most cases, the only thing that needs to be restored is the software and the data. A warm site takes longer to restore than a hot site but less than a cold site.
Why wouldn't it be B since it said it can't mirror and a hot site mirrors.

comments.content: It doesnâ€™t have the budget to mirror.. A hot site is the most expensive option. Hence, warm is the better option since cold site is just the building itself with electricity and HVAC system.

questions.question_text: A company requires a disaster recovery site to have equipment ready to go in the event of a disaster at its main datacenter. The company does not have the budget to mirror all the live data to the disaster recovery site. Which of the following concepts should the company select?

discussion.content: show interface will allow one to see the uplink states of each port.

Selected Answer: D
D. "show interface" is the command-line tool that the technician should use to determine where the incident is occurring. The "show interface" command displays information about the interfaces on a switch, including their operational status, utilization, error statistics, and other key performance metrics.

Selected Answer: D
start with d show interface, then e. show counters if it's not obvious with the interface command to look for crc errors.

Selected Answer: D
D - correct

Selected Answer: D
D. show interface command is used to display statistics and status information for an interface on a switch. It can be used to identify any issues with the uplinks and can help in troubleshooting the issue.

Selected Answer: D
show interface is correct

Selected Answer: D
show interface is correfct.

show interface

questions.question_text: An IT technician suspects a break in one of the uplinks that provides connectivity to the core switch. Which of the following command-line tools should the technician use to determine where the incident is occurring?

choices.C: Look for a rogue DHCP server on the network.
choices.D: Replace the cable connecting the modem and the workstation.
choices.B: Check for asymmetrical routing on the modem.
choices.A: Identify the switching loops between the modem and the workstation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Replace the cable connecting the modem and the workstation is the correct answer.

DSL synchronization is the process of establishing a connection between the modem and the service provider's central office. After verifying that the modem is synchronized with the central office, the next step is to ensure that there is a working connection between the modem and the workstation. If the link LEDs on the workstation and modem do not light up, it's likely due to a problem with the cable connecting the two devices. The technician should replace the cable to resolve the issue.

Selected Answer: D
the answer is D

Selected Answer: D
A switching loop is when there is more than one Layer 2 path exists between two endpoints, but would still display a light due to their attempts at data transfer that would eventually degrade in a broadcast storm.
If workstation & modem cable (Crossover DCE-DTE) is not carrying power through, then there would be no light, & it must be replaced.
This is one of those solutions where you think small and simple. D would be correct as both of them are lacking on network lights. OSI model Layer 1 Physical.

Selected Answer: D
It's likely a cable problem. replace cable

Selected Answer: D
The link LEDs on the workstation and modem do not light up, so cable may be a root cause.

questions.question_text: A technician is connecting DSL for a new customer. After installing and connecting the on-premises equipment, the technician verifies DSL synchronization. When connecting to a workstation, however, the link LEDs on the workstation and modem do not light up. Which of the following should the technician perform during troubleshooting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) can provide data storage, hardware options, and scalability to a third-party company that cannot afford new devices. With IaaS, the provider offers virtualized computing resources over the internet, including storage, networking, and servers, allowing clients to use infrastructure without having to purchase and maintain it themselves.

Selected Answer: B
Infrastructure as a service (IaaS) is an instant computing infrastructure, provisioned, and managed over the internet, this even goes as far at to giving hardware options to the company. Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is a cloud computing service that enables a consumer to outsource computing equipment purchases and running their own data center. IaaS quickly scales up and down with demand, letting you pay only for what you use. It helps you avoid the expense and complexity of buying and managing your physical servers and other data center infrastructure. Each resource is offered as a separate service component, and you only need to rent a particular one for as long as you need it. A cloud computing service provider manages the infrastructure while you purchase, install, configure, and manage your software.

Selected Answer: B
Infrastructure as a service (IaaS) is an instant computing infrastructure, provisioned, and managed over the internet to take load off of hardware. Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is a cloud computing service that enables a consumer to outsource computing equipment purchases and running their own data center. IaaS quickly scales up and down with demand, letting you pay only for what you use. It helps you avoid the expense and complexity of buying and managing your physical servers and other data center infrastructure. Each resource is offered as a separate service component, and you only need to rent a particular one for as long as you need it. A cloud computing service provider manages the infrastructure while you purchase, install, configure, and manage your software.

Selected Answer: B
Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is a means of provisioning IT resources such as 
servers, load balancers, and storage area network (SAN) components quickly.
Hardware = Iaas!

Selected Answer: B
IAAS IS THE correct answer HERE

The question is vague. Both IaaS and DaaS can considered the answer, however, IaaS is the better answer because DaaS require compatible devices thus the scalability is proportional to the availability of these devices. IaaS on the other hand is servers and one can scale those up in the background with just a click of the mouse.

comments.content:
The answer is 100% IAAS - infrastructure as a service. DAAS only allows you to virtualise and scale desktops. 

https://www.citrix.com/blogs/2022/01/20/saas-vs-paas-vs-iaas-vs-daas/

discussion.content: I believe the answer should be DaaS. DAAS can be a Linux or Windows OS, plus the storage needed. Highly scalable and for a fixed priced. If you went with IAAS, you have the option to buy separately and install your own OS. This seems rather expensive way to go to me.

questions.question_text: Which of the following services can provide data storage, hardware options, and scalability to a third-party company that cannot afford new devices?

A network administrator is talking to different vendors about acquiring technology to support a new project for a large company. Which of the following documents will MOST likely need to be signed before information about the project is shared?

discussion.content:
NDAs can also be used when two organizations work together to develop a
new product. Because certain information must be shared to make the partnership successful,
NDAs are signed to ensure that each partnerâ€™s data is protected.

A nondisclosure agreement (NDA) is an agreement between two parties that defines what
information is considered confidential and cannot be shared outside the two parties.

Selected Answer: B
NDA - non disclosure agreement.
Of course NDA!!!

Selected Answer: B
B. NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement) is a legal contract between at least two parties that outlines confidential material, knowledge, or information that the parties wish to share with one another for certain purposes but wish to restrict from generalized use by third parties. Therefore, before sharing any confidential information about the project with a vendor, the network administrator needs to sign an NDA.

Selected Answer: B
- A Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policy is a workplace policy that allows employees to use their personal devices for work purposes.
- A Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) is a legal contract that restricts the sharing of confidential information between parties.
- A Service Level Agreement (SLA) is a contractual agreement between a service provider and its customers that defines the level of service expected and includes metrics for measuring the service.
- A Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) is a written agreement between two parties that outlines the terms and understanding of a relationship or cooperation, but is not legally binding.
